import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots

source.2965c944:
# To find out how many respondents have cancer, diabetis and heart disease
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(15, 5), sharey=True)

sns.countplot(ax=axes[0], x=raw_data.cancer)
axes[0].set_title('Number of respondents have cancer')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[1], x=raw_data.diabetes)
axes[1].set_title('Number of respondents have diabetes')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[2], x=raw_data.heart_disease)
axes[2].set_title('Number of respondents have Heart disease')
source.8286cfdd:
df = raw_data[['cancer','diabetes','heart_disease']]
fig = px.parallel_categories(df, title='Link between respondents who have cancer, diabetes and heart disease')

fig.show()
source.dd07e5b6:
# To Find out belly botton type of respondents with respect to their health issue
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(15, 5), sharey=True)

sns.countplot(ax=axes[0], x=raw_data.belly, hue=raw_data.cancer)
axes[0].set_title('Belly type of cancer patients')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[1], x=raw_data.belly, hue=raw_data.diabetes)
axes[1].set_title('Belly type of diabetes patients')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[2], x=raw_data.belly, hue=raw_data.heart_disease)
axes[2].set_title('Belly type  of Heart disease patients')
source.248a7f4f:
# To find out how many respondents are having smoking habit
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(15, 5), sharey=True)

sns.countplot(ax=axes[0], x=raw_data.currently_smoke)
axes[0].set_title('Number of respondents who are smoking currently')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[1], x=raw_data.quit_smoking,hue=raw_data.ever_smoked)
axes[1].set_title('Number of respondents who quit smoking')

sns.countplot(ax=axes[2], x=raw_data.smoke_often)
axes[2].set_title('Number of respondents who are smoking often')

source.a5ca44de:
# To find out how many White, Black, Asian and Nativeamer respondents are there
fig, axes = plt.subplots(2,4, figsize=(15, 10), sharey=True)

sns.countplot(ax=axes[0][0], x=raw_data.WHITE, hue=raw_data.Jewish)
axes[0][0].set_title('Number of White people')
sns.countplot(ax=axes[0][1], x=raw_data.BLACK, hue=raw_data.Jewish)
axes[0][1].set_title('Number of Black people')
sns.countplot(ax=axes[0][2], x=raw_data.ASIAN, hue=raw_data.Jewish)
axes[0][2].set_title('Number of Asian people')
sns.countplot(ax=axes[0][3], x=raw_data.NATIVEAMER, hue=raw_data.Jewish)
axes[0][3].set_title('Number of Nativeamer people')
sns.countplot(ax=axes[1][0], x=raw_data.WHITE, hue=raw_data.atheist)
sns.countplot(ax=axes[1][1], x=raw_data.BLACK, hue=raw_data.atheist)
sns.countplot(ax=axes[1][2], x=raw_data.ASIAN, hue=raw_data.atheist)
sns.countplot(ax=axes[1][3], x=raw_data.NATIVEAMER, hue=raw_data.atheist)

"""Seperating data which have p_value below 0.05 
as the metric for statistical significance equates to an error rate of 5 percent"""
P_VALUES=p_value_data[p_value_data['p_values']<0.05]

source.c5837e91: Around 28 respondents have cancer, 15 members have diabetes and 20 members have heart disease
source.4f5ca6ab: ### With the help of regression p_values, found correlation between some of the characteristics and dietary habits of survey-takers
source.899dd71f:
* Out of 38 respondents who did not smoke ever, 10 do not have any health issues. 10 do not have diabetes and heart disease but cancer. 4 have all the three issues.
* Only one person among 5 who are smoking currently, do not have any health issues, remaining are having one or other health issues.
source.b12016e6:
* According to the data we can say that, there link between heart disease and eating sauce ice creame and tortilla
* From above plot we can also say that, people who have heat disease had sauce ice cream and tortillas more compared to the people who do not have heart disease
* 6 members had sauce ice creame for 2 times, all of them are having hear disease.
source.01200832: From above plot we can say that, people who have diabetes were taken very high grams of yogurt compared to who do not have diabetes.
source.d4fcff2e:
* Highly 13 members took veggies for 8 times in a week and 12 members took 7 times.
* 13 members took fruits for 7 times in a week, high number of respondents took fruits in between 1-5 times.
* 49 members were taken water for 9 times in a day.
source.8206ea54:
* From above plot we can say that, people who have diabetes took more amount of sweets in grams.
* People who do not have diabetes took sweets in between 0 and 400 grams.
source.7d87a3aa: Coffee, hot tea, iced tea, orange juice, soda and sports drink was taken more frequently by more number of respondents, than compared to other drinks.

source.086015db:
* It is suggested that, people who are suffering from cancer, diabetes and heart disease, should decrease smoking
* based on results, it is suggested that, people who are having cancer should decrease eating peanuts and other nuts.
* It recommended that to decrease eating plain yogurt for people who are having diabetes.
* people who are having heart disease should decrease eating sauce ice cream

source.776d0940: # **Finding out, link between characteristic and food**
source.881330f5: Only 9 out of 54 respondents are taking sugar in coffee and tea, in quantity of 1 or 2 spoons.
source.543670b5:
* According to the p values from data there is a relation between having cancer and eating habit of peanuts and cooked green.
* From above plots we can clearly say that, people who have cancer had more peanuts and other nuts in grams compared to others who do not have cancer. and they also had more cooked greens compared to others.
source.e3cfdcc5: Most of the respondents (37) were taking three meals per day, 13 members took only 2 meals per day, only few are taking 4 or 5 meals per day.
source.15210c7e: According to p values, there is a relation between people who have diabetes and their eating habit of yougurt and sweets.
source.a52348ab:
* Out of 54 survey takers, only 5 of them have all health issues (Cancer, Diabetes and heart disease). 15 of them do not have any health issues.
* 93 percent of the members, who do not have health issues, are not smoking currently.
* 90 percent of the survey-takers have innie type of belly button.
* 7 members, who do not have any pet, also do not have any health issues.
* 5 members, who have all three health issues, also have dog.
* 70 percent of the survey-takers are having 3 meals per day.
* 52 out of 54 members have non-veg (meat and fish).
* 83 percent of them do not add sugar in their tea or coffee.
* Almost all the survey-takers drink alcohol.
source.dc0bb681: Most of the respondents(49) have innie belly button type, only 5 members have outie type
source.1f76449e:
* 50 members eat both meat and fish, one person eats only meat not fish and one person eats fish but not meat.
* Two members do not have either meat or fish
source.66b7b04f:
* In 54 respondents, 51 are white, 1 is black and 2 are asian.
* one of the white is also nativeamer
* only two white members are jewish and 35 are atheist
* no of the black and nativeamer members are either jewish or atheist
* there were two asians both of them are atheists
source.56172491:
* From above plot we can say that, 5 respondents have all three health issues (Cancer, Diabetes and Heart disease).
* 11 respondents only have cancer, 5 have diabetes along with cancer and 7 members have heart disease along with cancer.
* Only 3 respondents have only diabetes and 2 members have heart disease along with diabetes.
* 6 respondents have heart disease alone.
* Most of the respondents (15) who do not have diabetes and heart disease also don't have cancer.
source.9ca1a2a8:
* All three alcohols were taken in different frequencies by different respondents, which is in between 1-9 times.
* Beer and cocktails were taken in quantity of 1 or 2 glasses.
* Wine was taken in mostly in quantity of 2 or 3 glasses.
source.fd7556c6:
From above information we can say that, raw_data contains in total 1093 features with 54 rows, and data does not contain any null values.
Data contains information related to person’s health issues, characteristics, food habits, smoking and drinking habits, vitamins/minerals intake, grams of food intake, kcal of food.
source.c6e2e4f6: Most of the drinks were taken in quantity of 1, only iced tea and oraange juice was taken in quantity of 2 cups.
source.a244aff5:
* 5 out of 54 respondents are smoking currently, 11 members had smoking habit, but they quit smoking
* out of 5 respondents, two members smoke often, remaing are smoking rarely.
